main event: An extremely bright light was observed at 20,000 feet near Cape Decision, Alaska, on December 5, 1964.
interesting points: The light was initially stationary before moving slowly southwest and then rapidly northeast., The duration of the observation was approximately 8-10 minutes., The maneuverability suggested it was likely an aircraft in distress., The object's speed was estimated to be in excess of 2000 mph., Weather conditions at the time included visibility of over 20 miles and a clear sky except for some scattered clouds.
sighted object: an extremely bright light, round in shape
witness description: CIVIS report from the Coast Guard Light Station at Cape Decision
